snippet: Beyond political changes, the military’s relinquishing of power last year has also given the Burmese freedom to debate once-taboo subjects, including what to call their country.
abstract: Myanmar has begun to search for a national identity defined by its people, not the cloistered vision imposed by military government that took power in 1962 and only relinquished control in 2011; nation's new freedom to debate includes the subject of country's name change from Burma in 1989 by military junta.
lead_paragraph: Beyond political changes, the military’s relinquishing of power last year has also given the Burmese freedom to debate once-taboo subjects, including what to call their country.

headline.main: Burma? Myanmar? New Freedom to Debate Includes Name
headline.print_headline: Burma? Myanmar? New Freedom to Debate Includes Name
